section.section:
A prospective adoptive parent and parent of a prospective adoptee may enter into a written agreement to allow contact, after the adoption, between:
the parent or other relative of the adoptee; and
the adoptee and adoptive parent.

An adoptive parent and former parent of an adoptee under this subtitle may enter into a written agreement to allow contact between:
a relative or former parent of the adoptee; and
the adoptee or adoptive parent.

text.section: An agreement made under this section applies to contact with an adoptee only while the adoptee is a minor.

An individual who prepares an agreement described in subsection (a)(1) of this section:
shall provide a copy to each party in a case pending as to the prospective adoptee under this subtitle; and
if the agreement so provides, shall redact identifying information from the copies.
Failure to comply with a condition of an agreement made under this section is not a ground for revoking consent to, or setting aside an order for, adoption.
If a dispute as to an agreement made under this section arises, a court may order the parties to engage in mediation to try to resolve the dispute.

section.section: A court shall enforce a written agreement made in accordance with this section unless enforcement is not in the adoptee's best interests.

If a party moves to modify a written agreement made in accordance with this section and satisfies the court that modification is justified because an exceptional circumstance has arisen and the court finds modification to be in an adoptee's best interests, the court may modify the agreement.
